page.title: 04LOCAL CUSTOMS-SUTTON IN A.
page.content: Although only a small minority of the local community are regular churchgoers most local customs revolve around the church calendar. {a)Christmas-}children put out pillow slips or stockings on Christmas Eve for presents on December 25th.Family Christmases with turkey dinner and plum pudding,nuts,chocolates and other traditional fare. {b)Mothering Sunday }March- children buy cards and presents for mother. {c)Easter}Palm crosses given in churches on Palm Sunday.Chidren given chocolate Easter Eggs and Easter cards exchanged. {d)Whitsuntide}"Whit Walks or processions of witness from all churches in the area come together for community worship in the Market Plac{ {e)Bonfire Night}November 5th Firework Displays. JANET POWELL.
